question: Which of the following features are considered for a compound to be aromatic?
option2: Complete delocalisation of the π electrons in the ring
option3: Presence of (4n + 2) π electrons in the ring where n is an integer
explanation: The following features are considered for a compound to be aromatic as per Huckel rule: (i) Planarity (ii) Complete delocalisation of the π electrons in the ring (iii) Presence of (4n + 2) π electrons in the ring where n is an integer (n = 0, 1, 2, . . .) where n can be any integer.
